content.label: Controls do not work. Simple as that.

Nice premise and graphics.    Unplayable with touch and only barely so with gamepad.   I know development was farmed out but did Konami not exercise any quality control?

title.label: Unresponsive Controls Leads to Subpar Gameplay

content.label: Frogger jumps a long time after you tap. Additionally, when going up blocks, he will unpredictably jump diagonally to get up obstacles. Not clean and can be quite jarring to play.

The swiping controls are horrible, at times I find myself swiping 2-3 times to go in whatever direction I need to go.

You have to either choose drafters movement increments AND a grid based world. Or NEITHER. Doing one without the other put you in situations that are impossible. The 100-bean super frog is extremely stupid since you have no control over when it happens. And you designed a from that once it touches water you lose all your lives no matter what. Absolute trash. If I were on the art team of this game that did an INCREDIBLE job, I would be fuming at the atrocious gameplay implementation. I could go on and on about the stupid decisions made in this game but it‚Äôs all obvious stuff to anyone who has played a video game and isn‚Äôt brain dead. GREAT JOB RUINING THIS CLASSIC.
Love this. Takes me back to the 80‚Äôs. Best Frogger so far!

The game looks great and the concept is good. However, the controls are horrible! Tapping to jump forward takes like half a second and the camera movement is unpredictable. I have these problems on both an iPad 6 and iPhone 11. The game shouldn‚Äôt be anywhere near this sluggish on the latest iPhone.
The game lagged so bad and the controls are so crappy. Deleting ASAP
Can‚Äôt listen to music nor podcasts while playing. Not worth your time.
Good game just wish I could play my own music while playing.!!!
Not better than crossy roads

title.label: Konami knows looks but has forgotten collisions

content.label: This game looks, sounds and evokes great feelings. The issue is when you‚Äôre trying to play the game to 100% it, the game readily makes certain frogs impossible to get to due to the screens horrible movement system. The game also kills your frog when barely touching a car and sometimes when trying to jump on a car (One of the games features), the cars count that as a hit with no difference between each attempt. The controls aren‚Äôt good either, as other users have noted, but they‚Äôre not the biggest problem in my play through. When I see Konami I expect quality, and in the way of looking like a little big planet game, they did provide quality, but need much more refinement on the game itself before anywhere near a 5 could be provided.

This game is almost unplayable due to poor controls. It lags terribly, and it doesn‚Äôt always register when you‚Äôre swiping different directions. If the controls are improved, I may consider re-downloading the game, and give it another try.
The controls make this game unplayable.  Fix it.
But the controls are terrible. Very unresponsive and laggy. Embarrassing for Konami and Apple
I‚Äôm playing on my iPhone X. It‚Äôs super frustrating. I wouldn‚Äôt play at all but my 3 year old son likes the frog. Please do something to improve the control of Frogger.

Fun casual game.  Control is not spectacular, but it‚Äôs ok once you get the hang of it.  I hope there are plans to introduce new levels & missions as an update, because once you finish all the levels at 3 stars there is no incentive to keep playing.

title.label: Love the idea of this game

content.label: Onscreen controls are difficult at best. While playing the game I find tapping becomes swiping and I‚Äôm not jumping forward or sideways like I intend.  I don‚Äôt know how many times the home button has gotten in the way or somehow the game gets paused.

I was impressed that it seemed to offer so many ways to control it. Keyboard and gamepad and touch? Sounds great! There‚Äôs even diagrams for controls I can‚Äôt decipher. What‚Äôs the half-filled rectangle with rounded corners? Is it a mouse? It looks like you throw the rectangle away from you to move forward, and strike the left corner to activate objects. Nothing to suggest how you might change directions. But hey, whatever the thing is, they support it. There‚Äôs literally more options than I can imagine!

* Keyboard controls double-fire, so you can‚Äôt move 1 square, it always moves 2 ‚Äî particularly strange since you can navigate the menus with arrow keys just fine
* Swipe gestures frequently don‚Äôt respond, or don‚Äôt go in the right direction
* Pencil makes it a bit easier, but not quite
* Tap works, so if the levels were a straight path with no obstacles, then it could be playable...of course, it wouldn‚Äôt be much fun, but hey, one little hop at a time

title.label: It‚Äôs a good thing there‚Äôs a free trial

content.label: For something that requires payment, this game really needs more finesse. The glitching is inexcusable. I‚Äôm Playing CoD with a lot less flaws than this and that‚Äôs free! I do like they put keyboard control but this doesn‚Äôt deserve to be on Apple Arcade
The controls are clunky and in many cases there are objects that I can climb in one job and sometimes those same objects require 5 jumps just to get on top of it. This game is inconsistent

title.label: Using a keyboard was easy until the jump speed was increased

content.label:
I had a lot of fun playing this game with a Bluetooth keyboard on my iPad. Jumps and throws were smooth and responsive, up until recently. 

Now, with every tap on the keyboard, it is impossible to move the frog just one step. Every tap becomes 2 steps and that makes using the keyboard useless. 

I know others have commented on how laggy taps and swipes were on the screen. But why change the taps on the keyboard?

I WILL NOT be playing this anymore until they change it back!
How are the controls bad?, to me they are really good and it‚Äôs a really good remake of the classic Frogger
It‚Äôs simple enough for everyone to play but has challenges to keep everyone coming back. Glitches have been minimal and I appreciate that.

Amazing art, bad controls and horrible level designs. I‚Äôm not sure who this game is supposed to appeal to, maybe it‚Äôs for little kids that just want to jump around as a cute frog?
Compared to the quality of most Apple Arcade offerings this game is really weak.

title.label: Recent update Saturday Oct 19 fixed text

content.label:
The game now has proper text & settings open, game now plays.
New update screwed up keyboard controls making frogger jump twice when pressing any of the WASD direction keys were as before it was frogger hopped once! What is going on here I give up will be deleting wait weeks for a fix and it‚Äôs not any better.

Rating based on gameplay:
The game is still tricky with touch controls & the moving screen doesn‚Äôt help much this isn‚Äôt a easy game especially do to picky touch controls.
Seems to still work better with WASD keyboard then Swiping with touch ...

Nope not updating...crickets...still... waiting for it to update after pressing update...crickets....other apps already done updating....didn‚Äôt even start updating yet....zzzzzz.....yawn...wha?...Finally!

I played a couple of levels when I initially downloaded the game, but since then the game is completely broken. Buttons disappear when pressed, the opening sequence plays every time I start the app and there is no way to get to the levels. I can‚Äôt believe that Apple featured this pile of junk on stage last month.

I can‚Äôt turn back to get a Frog I get mad at it sometimes but I‚Äôm stuck on  level 2nd and it‚Äôs hard for little kids üôÅ but sometimes it‚Äôs pretty fun I like how you can get up and blow up stuff and it‚Äôs not really fun and very weird for meü§®

Love love love this game. So cute. Quickly became obsessed. Took hours & days to progress to 3rd house. Progress has reset back to 1st house. Apple can‚Äôt help fix & the link on the Frogger site goes to a Konami page that doesn‚Äôt even list Frogger. And the chat is ‚Äòoffline @ 4pm est time on a weekday. title.label: Too Hard plus Controls are crap

content.label: This game is fun and frustrating. Plus The controls are crap. And it‚Äôs too glitchy. I recommend you fix this ASAP...

The game design is great the biggest problem is the game play the control lags significantly. The frog is not very responsive to the inputs I put in. Also there are times when the frog must jump higher than normal and at times he does it but there‚Äôs no way to make the frog jump higher, faster, or further on command. Would be a great game if the drag control wasn‚Äôt so frustrating.
They really need to work on the touch response of this game. Game has huge potential but it‚Äôs annoying playing a game where the movements aren‚Äôt responsive to swiping. Fix your game.
Using touch screen or keyboard controls are terrible. They are sloppy and sometimes do not register at all.

title.label: Terrible controls even with a controller

content.label:
I don‚Äôt know who this game is supposed to appeal to. I see many touting it as a great children‚Äôs game, but this is one of the hardest and most frustrating games I‚Äôve ever played (mostly due to poor controls). Nothing bounces or moves the way you expect, and trying to save all of the froglets in each level is an exercise in frustration.

I know the touch controls are legendary in their awful execution, but trust me, you‚Äôre not missing out on much with a controller. I still die in almost every level because I‚Äôm fighting the controls.

We know Konami is a bad company, but this game should not be on Arcade. It is easily the worst thing on here (even worse than ShockRods).

This game is amazing fun and really creative, however this is just way to hard, I barley could pass the second level with full heart, and catching all the frogs, but the 3rd level was another word for hard! If you fall in the sink you have less then 3 seconds to get out even though to swim to it take around 5 seconds! I was shocked to see this game was recommended for 4 and up. Considering how hard this game was it was a pure shock people thought that a 4 year old could win this!!!
App still does not display text. I have uninstalled and reinstalled but no luck.

title.label: Glitchy game that NEEDS to be patched yesterday!

content.label:
Frogger in Toy Town was a title I was actually looking forward to upon the launch of Apple Arcade. Unfortunately, it‚Äôs been riddled with all sorts of issues that render it unplayable. On my iPhone 11, it appears to install a (broken) Japanese version. Text and dialogue is either empty replaced by a series of question marks and dashes (?- - -), while some buttons have visibly hiragana text. Attempting to set the language to English is a hassle. The settings button completely disappears upon toggling with no settings menu showing up at all. The little bit I am able to play actually plays fine. The lack of discernible buttons and working menus prevent me from progressing forward, however. I‚Äôve tried removing and reinstalling the game as well as updating my iOS software and restarting. No solution thus far here. 

On my iPad, Frogger actually forced it to shut down for power issues despite my iPad having 38% charge on the battery. The text/menu issues aren‚Äôt present here but the random shutdown during the opening cutscene makes the game unplayable. I can‚Äôt even make it to the first level because of this.

I‚Äôm hoping the devs see this comment or the others and release an update patching these issues. This isn‚Äôt a bad game, but it won‚Äôt be any good hindered by these issues.
The game will not sync between phone and iPad and on iPhone everything is just showing question marks everywhere :-( please help

title.label: Unable to use - defaulted to Japanese

content.label: I live in the US. The game is unplayable. All dialog boxes are in Japanese. Tapping the settings icon does nothing. I am unable to even start the game on the 1at level for some reason.

For a game where super precise, timely movement is the only way to succeed...Konami have totally blown it with arguably the worst touch screen controls I have yet experienced in a mobile game.  Even when my MiFi controller arrives (motivated by the awful deficiencies of this very game) my review will remain a One Star until this issue is fixed.  Because Frogger - despite its charming graphics and fresh take on an old classic - is only playable right now as an Anger Management exercise.
The controls ruin what would have been an otherwise good game.

title.label: Has potential but controls are crap

content.label: This game has the potential to be great. Like everyone else has said the controls are crap. Frogger is slow and makes it even worse with how the controls work. There is a specific level where you need to go up a hill and collect gems. In order to get a perfect score you need to collect 23 gems. It‚Äôs impossible with how slow frogger goes up the hill. You have to mash the screen to get him to move well but you also need to move left or right to avoid cans rolling down the hill. With the time and how slow frogger goes its impossible. Until this gets fixed I WILL NOT be playing.

The game is a classic so I love it but I hate that I can‚Äôt listen to music while I play.. can you improve if not imma have to get rid of the game I‚Äôm sorry no matter how much of a loved game it is sorry you guys need to compromise with us too so plz help
